author: Shiv Sahay Singh
text:
West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee says a lot of misinformation is being spread about the incident.

Nearly a week after the violence at Kailachak in Malda district, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Saturday the issue was distorted and that the State government had managed the situation.

To a question on the sidelines of a programme, Ms. Banerjee said the incident was the result of a scuffle between the BSF and local people.

‘State not involved’

“BSF versus people there was a struggle (sic). The State is not involved in any manner. I think you should not ask this question, this is not the appropriate forum,” Ms. Banerjee told journalists.

The Chief Minister went on to say that a lot of misinformation had been spread about the incident.

All false, says BJP

The BJP was quick to dismiss her remarks as falsehood. “If it was really a fight between the BSF and the locals, then why was the Kaliachak police station attacked and police vehicles torched?” BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha told The Hindu .

‘It was the result of a scuffle between the BSF and locals and we managed the situation’
title: Malda incident was distorted: Mamata
